name: Redux T-Shirt (2013)
description:
Available in navy blue with teal print (women's) or white print (men's/unisex).

Designed and screen printed in collaboration with Redux studio artists Karen Ann Myers, Lindsay Windham and Alizey Khan.

T-Shirt blanks by Next Level Clothing, donated by Cul2Vate Promotional Products.

name: Mark Hosford T-Shirt (2012)
description:
Available in a white only.

Mark Hosford designed this T-Shirt in conjunction with the Redux show "Subtle Imperfections: Works by Janice Jakielski and Mark Hosford". The design depicts a character also featured on the mural Mark designed for the exhibition.

All designs were printed on American Apparel 100% Fine Jersey cotton.

The Men's (Unisex) Tshirts were printed on a American Apparel 2001 Fine Jersey Short Sleeve T-Shirt. The Women's Tshirts were printed on a American Apparel 2102 Fine Jersey Short Sleeve T-Shirt.

This shirt was designed and printed by Mark Hosford. Mark Hosford playfully alludes to the Surrealists’ idea that psychological truths can be revealed through drawing. In his Rorschach drawings, he takes for his starting point light gray ink jet blots, which were invented to help psychologists lead their patients to reveal repressed meanings through free association. Hosford transforms these symmetrical organic forms by inlaying penciled-in images of his own eccentric devising; monstrous creatures and hybrid beings reminiscent of the dark animation of the Brothers Quay and Jan Švankmajer. Hosford’s vibrant and meticulous screenprints focus on investigations of the human condition, utilizing a stylistic amalgamation of his childhood affinity for comics, animation, punk, metal, tattoo, horror, sci-fi, street art, and counter culture. To learn more about Mark, visit www.markhosford.com.

name: Seth Gadsden T-Shirt (2011)
description:
Six local artists were asked to design a t-shirt that was hand screen printed in the Redux print shop. Only 30 t-shirts by each artist were printed. They are available for purchase online or in the Redux Store for $30 each. All sales of Tshirts will help to support the diverse programming at Redux. 2011 shirt artists are: Bunny Fox, Tony Csavas, Seth Gadsden, Conrad Guevara, Neve Inspired, and Ivy Williams.

All designs were printed on American Apparel 100% Fine Jersey cotton.

The Men's (Unisex) Tshirts were printed on a American Apparel 2001 Fine Jersey Short Sleeve T-Shirt. The Women's Tshirts were printed on a American Apparel 2102 Fine Jersey Short Sleeve T-Shirt.

This shirt was designed and printed by Seth Gadsden. Seth is a practicing artist currently based in Clover, SC. To learn more about his work, please visit www.sethgadsden.com.

name: Flying Her Kite by Teil Duncan
description: Image size: 10.75" x 14" Edition size: 15 About Teil: Teil Duncan is an oil painter from Columbus, Georgia with a BA in painting from Auburn University. Her direct influences and inspirations are the people and places in which she is surrounded. The vibrant colors of Charleston and the energy it exudes is translated onto the canvas, portraying her own unique language through paint. Her central medium has consistently been oils and acrylics; however, her style is ever evolving and changing, from realism to non-objective artwork. Teil has exhibited in various shows throughout Columbus, Auburn and Charleston and continues to paint in her studio at Redux. >Visit Artist's Website Thank you for your support! When you purchase art from the Redux Store, you are helping to support one of the region's most compelling contemporary art centers and its wonderfully talented studio artists. Proceeds from your purchase are used to support adult and youth education and outreach programs, special exhibitions, studio facilities, and many of the daily expenses involved with operating a dynamic contemporary art center. >Visit Redux's Website *Note that all prints are made to order, so please allow for a 2-week delivery time. If you need immediate assistance, please contact Redux directly at (843) 722-0697.

name: After Blossfeldt by Jen Ervin
description: Image size: 8.65" x 14" Edition size: 15 About Jen: Jen Ervin received her MFA from Boston University and her BA from Francis Marion University. Ervin’s work is rich in sensory memory, often reflecting themes of solitude, intimacy and the uniqueness of the ordinary. She combines a stripped-down technique with the careful selection of details to develop a visceral, poetic language that leans on imperfection. Recent solo shows include Becoming at Francis Marion University and Moving Into Stillness at the Saul Alexander Gallery. >Visit Artist's Website Support a Cause: Jen is graciously donating her proceeds from print sales to a charity that is near and dear to her heart, the Epilepsy Foundation of America. The Epilepsy Foundation is the national non-profit agency leading the fight to stop seizures and find a cure for the nearly 3 million people with epilepsy in the U.S. and their families. >Visit Charity's Website Thank you for your support! When you purchase art from the Redux Store, you are helping to support one of the region's most compelling contemporary art centers and its wonderfully talented studio artists. Proceeds from your purchase are used to support adult and youth education and outreach programs, special exhibitions, studio facilities, and many of the daily expenses involved with operating a dynamic contemporary art center. >Visit Redux's Website *Note that all prints are made to order, so please allow for a 2-week delivery time. name: Secret Keeper by Xin Lu
description: Image size: 14" x 14" Edition size: 15 About Xin: Xin Lu received her BA from Vanderbilt University in studio arts and psychology. Her mixed media monoprints are inspired by her childhood memories and recent travels to her home country of China. Lu’s works are imbued with a sense of longing for a place to belong. She was the recipient of the prestigious Margaret Stonewall Wooldride Hamblet Award. Solo exhibits include Somewhere In Between, Vanderbilt Fine Arts Gallery, Celestial Comforts, Cumberland Gallery, Nashville TN. Lu is represented by Cumberland Gallery in Nashville, TN. >Visit Artist's Website Support a Cause: Xin is graciously donating the proceeds from her print sales to a charity that is close to her heart, the Journey House of Charleston. The Journey House provides a place to assist with the many needs that come along with having a child with a chronic or life-threatening condition for children receiving treatment at the Medical University of South Carolina. >Visit Charity's Website Thank you for your support! When you purchase art from the Redux Store, you are helping to support one of the region's most compelling contemporary art centers and its wonderfully talented studio artists. name: Come Here Boy by Karen Ann Myers
description: Image size: 17" x 24" Edition size: 1 (Handmade) About Karen: Karen Ann Myers received her MFA in Painting from Boston University and her BFA in Studio Art from Michigan State University. Myers’ psychologically intense, densely decorated portraits examine our culture’s hyper-sexualized obsession with glamour and physical beauty, touching on its aesthetic extremes, seductive appeal, and emotional casualties. She is currently serving as the Assistant Director at the Halsey Institute of Contemporary Art at the College of Charleston and served as Redux’s Executive Director from 2009 – 2011. Recent exhibitions include Thinking of You at LUIS de JESUS, Los Angeles, CA, My Sweet, Sweet… at the Dalton Gallery, Atlanta, GA, Incite at Robert Steele Gallery, NY, and A Room of Her Own at SCOOP Studios, Charleston, SC. >Visit Artist's Website Thank you for your support! When you purchase art from the Redux Store, you are helping to support one of the region's most compelling contemporary art centers and its wonderfully talented studio artists. Proceeds from your purchase are used to support adult and youth education and outreach programs, special exhibitions, studio facilities, and many of the daily expenses involved with operating a dynamic contemporary art center. >Visit Redux's Website *Note that all prints are made to order, so please allow for a 2-week delivery time. name: Untitled 1 by Jane Ann Sweeny
description: Image size: 13" x 14" Edition size: 15 About Jane: Jane Ann Sweeny received her BFA in Printmaking from Clemson University. She is a visual artist and an actress, having spent 5 years in Los Angeles to focus on her craft. Jane Ann’s work focuses on the human condition, and the expression of things left unsaid. Her priority in life and art is to remove the masks of our culture and speak truth. Women especially are confined by the masks that our society dictates. Jane Ann’s art is quickly getting recognition and a place in the local art community in Charleston, SC. Thank you for your support! When you purchase art from the Redux Store, you are helping to support one of the region's most compelling contemporary art centers and its wonderfully talented studio artists. name: Madeline by Lulie Wallace
description: Image size: 10.4" x 14" Edition size: 15 About Lulie: Lulie studied art at the College of Charleston earning her BFA in Painting. Referencing the rustic landscapes of her native Columbus, Georgia and the bright colors of her home in Charleston, Lulie’s palate has matured into a distinct style that brings out the life of her subject matter. Evolving from an ongoing experiment with colors, her expressionist approach captures the texture of materials through a study of light and shadow. >Visit Artist's Website Thank you for your support! When you purchase art from the Redux Store, you are helping to support one of the region's most compelling contemporary art centers and its wonderfully talented studio artists. name: Seconds Past by Charles E. Williams
description: Image size: 11" x 14" Edition size: 15 About Charles: Charles E. Williams received his BFA in Studio Art from Savannah College of Art and Design. His signature drip style of contemporary landscapes fused with traditional practices has led him to many collectors. Recent exhibitions in South Carolina include Southern Exposure, Capture, What We Choose, and Fortune. In 2009, Charles was awarded a fellowship from the Hudson River Landscape School by the Grand Central Academy in New York. Thereafter, he was selected for the 2011 Southwest Art Magazine issue of 21 Emerging under 31, as well as a semi-finalist for the landscape category in Artist Magazine. >Visit Artist's Website Thank you for your support! When you purchase art from the Redux Store, you are helping to support one of the region's most compelling contemporary art centers and its wonderfully talented studio artists.
